Starter Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

messages.content:
healing! :D
stalling! D:
probably worse than the ironclad one but healing is good
a mostly necessary relic for Slimbo with the low max hp
yeah, it requires you to build goop and use it enough times before the fight ends
also slime boss has a lot more self damage in the kit, so it's not exactly broken, just helps keep them stable
is the boss relic upgrade as bad as the ironclad one?
i think it's much better actually
<black goo>

embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Replaces Heart of Goo.

footer.text: <black goo> = black heart of goo, 74% sure

messages.content: still would avoid taking this most of the time tho
it looks about the same, but slime boss loves the healing, and is nowhere near as energy hungry as ironclad
...i don't think they are, anyway 🤔
they have quite a few 0 costs
yea
quite a bit more than IC
also Modded Character™️ damage output at times
so you can end fights faster even without energy
yeah but I think most relics that aren't "safe boss relics you take because the other two were runic dome and snecko eye in a 0 cost deck" are better than this
"Ah sweet tiny house"
As for boss swapping I think this relic baits it pretty hard cause it's kind of boring but I don't think it's really worth it if you're trying to win
it's like burning blood
except conditional
i would only boss swap on slimbo if the boss was defect
pretty much because it's forced; your act is gonna suffer without it
slime boss is the only downfall boss I don't swap on these days. Healing 8 every combat is pretty good and theres other good whale bonuses to pick
slime boss isnt nearly as energy hungry as other characters too which makes swapping into an energy relic less powerful (when compared to other bosses like snecko and champ)
are you saying you swap all the time on other characters? or just that slime boss is the only one you never swap on
for guardian, hexaghost, snecko and champ I swap 90% of the time
hexaghost is weird to me
wow!
for the others its like 60+
I think hexaghost starter relic is really good
Hexa?
interesting choice
for auto and gremlins I like to swap if its the best option but theres other whale bonuses that are better for them I would like to take instead (double remove and transform are the main 2)

hexaghost swap really hurts your act one but helps you a lot more going into late game where getting just 4 block a turn isnt as good as other relics. My personal theory with hexaghost is that act 1 is really great for you anyways so you can afford to lose your starter relic. Plus hexaghost has a power that gives block on ignite that you can easily draft,

lastly the main reason I boss swap is to feel something. Runs can feel really samey when your just playing the same things over and over again because they always win by boss swapping you add chaos into your run you have to work around.
sometimes there's the opposite problem

> the main reason I boss swap is to feel something
lmao
where boss swapping is overly consistent
same
so true
I think if you where to play gremlins 100% optimally you would swap less, but I also think if you where to do that then gremlins would never have the chance to lose (I think the same for auto)
fr tho, pretty much the only reason i can play ironclad anymore
same reasoning as hexa btw
for guardian at least I think that swap is acutally just always the best decision. Gear up is absolutely awful and i'd rather hit busted crown then have it as my starter relic
don't u diss my boi Gear Up
don't diss gear up at all
no I will 10 brace one time is pretty mid and you even have to pay energy for it (I didnt like the relic before it got nerfed and now needing to pay energy for something that used be free feels bad)
gotta move that gear up
it lets you get into defensive mode on first shuffle with only it and gear up
also you can stasis the gear up
also old bronze gear was even worse
but you can also just draft a good card into your deck can also get into defensive mode by playing two cards.
I started liking gear up alot more when I realized I can just play it early if I have the energy
I used to keep saving it but now I usually just play it turn 1
when I used the relic I also just ended up playing it on turn 1 in most fights anyways; thats why I think the new version is worse
differing perspectives I see
guardian defensive mode guide comes out tomorrow on my channel and i talk about why i like gear up there
sub and ring that bell
we need calling bell emote
oh and the relics you replace gear up with are almost always great too; energy relic in act 1 is super good with twin slam
guardian might have status but you still really want to have 4 energys to get going (and not every run is going to be stasis based)
i agree 4 energy start is good

the only other character I didnt mention was hermit; thats because I'm still not too sure what to think about boss swap on him. Your locket is very good for the first half of the game; you can treat the card like a blasphemy+ and use it to end fights sooner. But hermit's main struggle is always end game specifically the last 4 fights and having a boss relic instead can save you
so the question is do you give up one of your classes main strengths to get a chance to help with one of your main weaknesses
i was thinking this exact thing pretty recently
currently I think i'm anti swap on hermit but like 3 weeks ago I was pro swap and maybe I'll change my mind yet again after playing more swap games
real answer is dont boss swap on hermit because the starter relic's upgrade is run winning
especially with the new-ish shadow cloak change
hermit boss swap feels just like defect boss swap to me (besides the starter upgrade thing, I agree that the locket goes hard)

defect swap feels so bad. Die to Nob Simulator II: Die Harder

embeds.title: MGS Cyborg Ninja: Make me feel alive again

messages.content:
I agree that this is largely a necessary relic for slime boss, considering the presence of tackle in the starting deck and their relatively low Max HP. It does make you play a lot like ironclad in the early game, playing more aggressively and facetanking enemy damage. Corrosive spit in the starter deck already does a solid job of supporting this, and it's fairly easy to pick up a few more goop cards or a mire slime to help proc it more frequently. Something a bit unusual is that it will attempt to heal you even if you are already full hp and consume a charge, so keep that in mind. You also may want to try and delay some hallway fights if you can, so that you can get maximum value by playing corrosive spit/other goop cards to proc it all 4 times. Upgrading corrosive spit first at the first campfire makes this easier to do, though it is also tempting to upgrade tackle to crush early elites.

It's probably a little worse than burning blood early on (tough to heal for more than 4 in fights like cultist and jaw wurm with the starting deck), but once you find 1-2 extra sources of gooping, it usually feels better, since you can heal for 2 more each fight. It also helps that tackles can be blocked in a way that cards like hemokinesis can't, so there is slightly less pressure on slime bosses health overall, which means this can keep you topped off more easily. It can also heal you midfight, where you have to actually survive the current fight to heal off of burning blood. Having heart of goo enables you to play very aggressively with tackles/high damage cards in the early game, which is very valuable for taking on all 3 elites. 

The sustain is not always necessary on slime boss, sometimes you just don't end up taking many tackles, and sometimes you are lucky to find mass feed or leech life, which can fulfill a similar function. I still think it's an excellent starter relic, letting you focus on taking burst damage cards early in the run, and making coffee dripper viable.
